title: Drawing, 1881
medium: Charcoal on cream wove paper, lined
markings: Stamped in ? ink, lower right: Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper- Union
signed: Signed in charcoal, at lower left: HOMER.
inscribed: Verso: Inscribed in graphite, upper right: (17)
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: Two women and a child lean over railing, looking out to sea, as men in raincoats and caps below the boardwalk also look out to sea. A Life Brigade house is directly in front of them, in the middleground; rough sea traversed by several shore bound ships, in the background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1881.
1881. Charcoal on cream wove paper, lined. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-17.
